words.definition: If someone or something is alive, they are not dead.
words.example: My grandmother is still alive at ninety-six.

words.definition: A bone is a hard part of the body.
words.example: I brought home a nice bone for my dog.

words.definition: To bother is to make the effort to do something.
words.example: No one bothered to wash the dishes today.

words.definition: A captain is the person who leads a ship or airplane.
words.example: The captain sailed his ship to Australia.

words.definition: The conclusion is the last part of something.
words.example: At the conclusion of the race, the spectators cheered for the winner.

words.definition: Doubt is a feeling of not being sure.
words.example: I have doubt that the story is true.

words.definition: To explore is to look for new places.
words.example: He loves to explore old caves.

words.definition: If something is foreign, it is from a different country.
words.example: He has travelled to many foreign countries.

words.definition: If you are glad, you are happy.
words.example: I am glad you came to my party.

words.definition: However means despite or not being limited by something.
words.example: She is a great cook; however, she never had formal training.

words.definition: Injustice is a lack of fairness or justice.
words.example: Putting an innocent person in jail is an injustice.

words.definition: If something is international, it involves more than one country.
words.example: The United Nations is an international organization.

words.definition: A lawyer is a person who works with the law.
words.example: The lawyer left the courthouse after the judge made a decision.

words.definition: To mention something is to speak about it.
words.example: The doctor mentioned that I should eat more fruit.

words.definition: A policy is a rule.
words.example: He told us that his policy was to put customers first.

words.definition: If something is social, it is about many people in a community.
words.example: People should come together and help the world with social problems.

words.definition: A speech is something said to a group of people.
words.example: She gave a great speech about helping people.

words.definition: A staff is a group of people who work for a business.
words.example: The staff at the hotel were very nice.

words.definition: If you go toward something, you go closer to it.
words.example: Santa Claus went toward the house and then up the chimney.

words.definition: Wood is the thing that trees are made of.
words.example: I put the wood into the fire.
